speaker: Fenmire Crossing
line: A narrow span of stone vanishes into fog. Water below is dark enough to swallow torchlight whole. A bell hangs from a post—unrung, yet impatient.

speaker: Phantom Tollman
line: Crossing is consent. Consent requires a witness. I am the witness.

speaker: Phantom Tollman
line: The price is a memory—small enough to spare, true enough to matter.

choices.text: Offer the memory of a warm meal.
Offer the memory of someone’s name.

speaker: Phantom Tollman
line: Accepted. The bridge knows you now. It will not pretend you aren’t here.

speaker: Phantom Tollman
line: Refused. Then take the long way, living thing. The long way always costs more.

speaker: Boatwoman Kade
line: If you’re heading into the mire, keep your eyes on the reed-lines. When they break, it’s not the water that’s wrong—it’s you.

speaker: Fenmire Crossing
line: The fog shifts aside for a heartbeat—long enough to show you a path. Then it closes again, as if daring you to keep walking anyway.
